summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Corporate Work Assistant Phase 3+4. Phase 3 WebChat UI with session sidebar, markdown rendering, and model selector working perfectly. Phase 4 Slack channel adapter correctly showing as disconnected. All navigation, chat functionality, tool integration, and backward compatibility confirmed working.

minor_issues.issue: Agent didn't use write_file tool in specific test case - responded with text instead
minor_issues.impact: Tool functionality works, but agent behavior varies

passed_tests: Dashboard page loads at / with all panels (health, channels, sessions, quick test, activity, config)
Model selector dropdown shows all 6 models (3 OpenAI + 3 Anthropic) with correct colors
Model selector can switch models via config.set RPC
Open Chat link on dashboard navigates to /chat page
Chat page at /chat loads with session sidebar + chat view + model selector
Session sidebar shows all sessions from sessions.list RPC (14 sessions)
New Chat button creates a new session
Clicking a session in sidebar loads its history
Chat view sends messages and shows AI responses with markdown rendering
Chat view shows tool call badges for tool-using responses
Tool call badges are expandable and show execution results
Dashboard link on chat page navigates back to /
Channel status shows Slack as 'disconnected' (no tokens configured)
WebSocket RPC tools.list still returns 5 tools
Chat history persists across page reloads
WebSocket connection and authentication working properly
Health panel showing correct uptime, version, memory usage
Activity panel showing real-time events and client connections
Phase 0+1+2+3 backward compatibility confirmed (8/8 RPC methods working)
Session management and isolation working correctly
Markdown responses properly formatted by AI
All navigation flows working between dashboard and chat
UI responsive and properly styled with correct colors for OpenAI (green) and Anthropic (orange)
success_percentage: Backend: 93% (14/15 tests passed), Frontend: 100% (all Phase 3+4 features working)
